patience.text: “Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.”
patience.author: A.A. Milne, Winnie-the-Pooh

patience.text: “Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.”
patience.author: Molière

patience.text: “The two hardest tests on the spiritual road are the patience to wait for the right moment and the courage not to be disappointed with what we encounter.”
patience.author: Paulo Coelho, Veronika Decides to Die

patience.text: “He that can have patience can have what he will.”
patience.author: Benjamin Franklin

patience.text: “Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.”
patience.author: Aristotle

patience.text: “Patience and wisdom walk hand in hand, like two one-armed lovers.”
patience.author: Jarod Kintz, $3.33

patience.text: “The strongest of all warriors are these two — Time and Patience.”
patience.author: Leo Tolstoy, War and Peace

patience.text: “Make your ego porous. Will is of little importance, complaining is nothing, fame is nothing. Openness, patience, receptivity, solitude is everything.”
patience.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

patience.text: “I am extraordinarily patient, provided I get my own way in the end.”
patience.author: Margaret Thatcher

patience.text: “Our patience will achieve more than our force.”
patience.author: Edmund Burke

patience.text: “Trying to understand is like straining through muddy water. Have the patience to wait! Be still and allow the mud to settle.”
patience.author: Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching

patience.text: “Talent is a long patience, and originality an effort of will and intense observation.”
patience.author: Gustave Flaubert

patience.text: “Patience is not passive waiting. Patience is active acceptance of the process required to attain your goals and dreams.”
patience.author: Ray A. Davis

patience.text: “Patience is not a virtue. It is an achievement.”
patience.author: Vera Nazarian

patience.text: “Everything comes if a man will only wait.”
patience.author: Benjamin Disraeli, Tancred

patience.text: “Even a snail will eventually reach its destination.”
patience.author: Gail Tsukiyama, The Street of a Thousand Blossoms

patience.text: “All human errors are impatience, a premature breaking off of methodical procedure, an apparent fencing-in of what is apparently at issue.”
patience.author: Franz Kafka

patience.text: “Some people can never understand that you have to wait, even for the best of things, until the right time comes.”
patience.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
